text: A referendum on changes to the electoral law was held in Cambodia on 26 January 1958. The changes would reduce the number of MPs from 91 to 61. It was approved by 99.9% of voters.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p68 Fresh elections under the new law took place in March. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Choice !Votes !% |- |align=left|For||1,206,855||99.9 |- |align=left|Against||545||0.1 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||– |- |align=left|Total||1,207,400||100 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||1,911,770|| |- |colspan=3 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:Referendums in Cambodia Category:1958 in Cambodia Category:1958 referendums Category:Electoral reform referendums Category:Electoral reform in Cambodia
title: 1958 Cambodian electoral law referendum
